title.narrative: Emergency support to alleviate the impact of the drought on the agricultural sector in Unryul and Anak counties of South Hwanghae province of the DPR Korea

description.narrative: The objective of the FAO project is to save essential standing crops and incrase production and productivity to protect food availability and nutrition status of vulnerable farming families through improving locally suitable irrigation systems and water conservation practices in Unryul and Anak counties of South Hwangae Province. With CERF funds, FAO will increase water regular water supply and increase agricultural productivity through the provision of water pumps to 23 cooperative farms in the most drought-affected districts. FAO estimates that with these inputs at least 40,000 hectares of drought-affected crop areas will be protected with irrigation. Some 28,466 cooperative farmers will benefit from this assistance in a six-month period.
